Explanation

In Module / Separate Module for Integration Test

We distinguish between a so called in Module integration tests and separated module integration tests. The in module means to have the integration tests within the same module which contains the unit tests and your production code src/main/java. This approach is usually used if you have only a single module.

The other approach is to have at least two modules plus a parent module which will work as the reactor for the projects. The assumption is to have structure like the following:

Unit Tests
Using classes from an other module within the current unit tests. Execution of unit tests within a test-jar.jar file (currently not supported by surefire plugin).
